// NOTES:
// Aliases don't have spaces in them!
// The indentations are with tabs!

// Game
// Game: (Red|Blue|Yellow)
Game: Red

// Images // TODO
// Image: <alias> <image path>

// Aliases // TODO
// TrainerAlias: <alias> <trainerID> // alias is how you name him, trainerID is how the application knows him as

// Custom trainers
// Trainer: <name> [:: <location>] :: <alias> <name>:<level> [..] // ID will be generated by the application (?)
Trainer: Rival 1 :: rival1 bulbasaur:5
Trainer: Bug Catcher 1 :: bug1 weedle:9
Trainer: Brock :: brock geodude:12 onix:14
Trainer: Bug Catcher 2 :: bug2 caterpie:10 weedle:10 caterpie:10
Trainer: Shorts Guy :: shorts rattata:11 ekans:11

// Route
Route: Red Any% Glitchless - Exarion Route
	S: New Game
		D: Clear any existing save file by pressing Up + B + Select on the game title screen
		D: New game: text speed fast, animations off, style shift
		D: Start a new game, and name yourself and your rival a one character name
	S: Pallet Town
		D: Exit out of your home, and head north towards Route 1. Prof. Oak will stop you and lead you back to his lab. After he and your rival are done talking, select the middle Pokeball on the table to get Squirtle. Name it a one character name, and go to head out of the lab. Your rival will stop you for a battle.
		GetP: #squirtle:5
		B: rival1
			Tail Whip x1-2, then Tackle until it faints.
		D: Head out of the lab, and north to Route 1
	S: Getting the Parcel to Oak
		S: Route 1
			D: You want to defeat an encounter here so that you have enough experience to get Lvl.8 at the Bug Catcher fight later. Only attempt to kill low level pokemon as higher levels take longer to kill.
			E: Route 1 :: 1:0 3:1 4:0 5:0 // TODO <description>
			D: Head north through the route to Viridian City.
		S: Viridian City
			D: Head straight into the Mart and collect Oak's Parcel. Exit, and head south back to Route 1.
		S: Route 1
			D: Head south, utilizing ledges to avoid as much grass as you can. If you have yet to kill an encounter, take the shorter route through the second-to-last grass patch; otherwise, walk around it.
		S: Pallet Town
			D: Head to the lab, finish the lengthy conversation with Prof. Oak and head back north once more.
	S: Getting Nidoran!
		S: Route 1
			D: Head north to Viridian City again, remembering to kill an encounter if you haven't already.
		S: Viridian City
			D: Head back into the Mart for the first shopping trip.
			D: The quantity of Poké Balls you buy is dependent on your own money management and how often you plan to reset. The recommended number is 8, but 7 is fine too. You only buy 6 if you plan on reseting if you fail to catch a nidoran twice, because you may risk running out of balls to catch HM slaves.
//			Shop: ... // TODO
			D: Head out of the Mart, and west to Route 22.
		S: Route 22
			D: Time for the Nidoran hunt. You want to catch a Lvl.3-4 Nidoran♂, and give it a one character name.
			D: Tackle Lvl.3 Nidorans once to make the catch easier, but just throw PokeBalls at Lvl.4 Nidorans.
			C: Route 22 :: 1 #3
			D: After you have your Nidoran, head back east to Viridian City.
	S: Viridian City
		D: Head north, and pick up the Potion hidden in the Cut tree on the left.
//		I: potionTree // TODO
		D: Continue north to Route 2, and straight through to Viridian Forest.
	S: Viridian Forest
		D: Avoid the trainers and walk on the encounterless tiles. Pick up the Antidote on your way up.
//		I: ViridianF
		B: bug1
			Tail Whip x2, then Tackle until it faints.
		D: After the battle, exit the grass and open the menu: Squirtle <-> Nidoran, [use potion], [use antidote]
		Swap: 0 1
			Swap Squirtle with Nidoran
		D: Exit Viridian Forest and head north to Pewter City.
	S: Pewter City
		D: Head straight into Brock's Gym, go left to avoid the Gym trainer and battle Brock.
		B: brock :: 0:0 0:1 1:0 1:1
			Geodude: switch to Squirtle, B x2-3, same for Onix
		D: -- Pewter Mart --
//		Shop: ... // TODO
		D: Exit the Mart and head east out of the city towards Route 3.
		D: Menu: go to Options and change your Battle Style from Shift to Set.
	S: Route 3
		B: bug2
			x3: Leer, HA x2
		D: Heal to full or near full for the next fight
		B: shorts
			x2: Leer, HA x2
		D: Potion before the next fight ONLY if you're at 1 HP.


=== // Ignore everything after this

=== Alternative ? ===
== R :: Red Any% Glitchless - Exarion Route
	= New Game
		Clear any existing save file by pressing Up + B + Select on the game title screen
		New game: text speed fast, animations off, style shift
		Start a new game, and name yourself and your rival a one character name
	= Pallet Town
		Exit out of your home, and head north towards Route 1. Prof. Oak will stop you and lead you back to his lab. After he and your rival are done talking, select the middle Pokeball on the table to get Squirtle. Name it a one character name, and go to head out of the lab. Your rival will stop you for a battle.
		#GetP #squirtle:5
		#B rival1 :: Tail Whip x1-2, then Tackle until it faints.
		Head out of the lab, and north to Route 1
	= Getting the Parcel to Oak
		= Route 1
			You want to defeat an encounter here so that you have enough experience to get Lvl.8 at the Bug Catcher fight later. Only attempt to kill low level pokemon as higher levels take longer to kill.
			#E Route 1 :: 1:0 3:1 4:0 5:0
			Head north through the route to Viridian City.
		= Viridian City
			Head straight into the Mart and collect Oak's Parcel. Exit, and head south back to Route 1.
		= Route 1
			Head south, utilizing ledges to avoid as much grass as you can. If you have yet to kill an encounter, take the shorter route through the second-to-last grass patch; otherwise, walk around it.
		= Pallet Town
			Head to the lab, finish the lengthy conversation with Prof. Oak and head back north once more.
	= Getting Nidoran!
		= Route 1
			Head north to Viridian City again, remembering to kill an encounter if you haven't already.
		= Viridian City
			Head back into the Mart for the first shopping trip.
			The quantity of Poké Balls you buy is dependent on your own money management and how often you plan to reset. The recommended number is 8, but 7 is fine too. You only buy 6 if you plan on reseting if you fail to catch a nidoran twice, because you may risk running out of balls to catch HM slaves.
//			#Shop ... // TODO
			Head out of the Mart, and west to Route 22.
		= Route 22
			Time for the Nidoran hunt. You want to catch a Lvl.3-4 Nidoran♂, and give it a one character name.
			Tackle Lvl.3 Nidorans once to make the catch easier, but just throw PokeBalls at Lvl.4 Nidorans.
			#C Route 22 :: 1 #3
			After you have your Nidoran, head back east to Viridian City.
	= Viridian City
		Head north, and pick up the Potion hidden in the Cut tree on the left.
//		#I potionTree // TODO
		Continue north to Route 2, and straight through to Viridian Forest.
	= Viridian Forest
		Avoid the trainers and walk on the encounterless tiles. Pick up the Antidote on your way up.
//		#I ViridianF
		#B bug1 :: Tail Whip x2, then Tackle until it faints.
		After the battle, exit the grass and open the menu: Squirtle <-> Nidoran, [use potion], [use antidote]
		#SwapP 0 1 :: Swap Squirtle with Nidoran
		Exit Viridian Forest and head north to Pewter City.
	= Pewter City
		Head straight into Brock's Gym, go left to avoid the Gym trainer and battle Brock.
		#B brock :: Geodude: switch to Squirtle, B x2-3, same for Onix
		-- Pewter Mart --
//		#Shop ... // TODO
		Exit the Mart and head east out of the city towards Route 3.
		Menu: go to Options and change your Battle Style from Shift to Set.
	= Route 3
		#B bug2 :: x3: Leer, HA x2
		Heal to full or near full for the next fight
		#B shorts :: x2: Leer, HA x2
		Potion before the next fight ONLY if you're at 1 HP.
